isis.stitle: TSI 94-08-04 - Speedometer and Tachometer Ground Clip Installation

subjectgroup.subject: Speedometer and Tachometer Ground Clip Installation

geninfo.para: This TSI describes the adding of ground clips to ground the speedometer and tachometer gauges.

When static electricity results in false movement (sweeping) of the speedometer and tachometer, ground clips can be added to ground the speedometer and tachometer gauges to the housing. All 9000 vehicles built after January 1, 1994 will have the ground clips installed.

step1.para: Remove speedometer/tachometer gauge unit from the vehicle.
Place unit in a clean work area. Clothing that is likely to cause static electricity should not be worn for this procedure.
Remove the front faceplate from the unit by removing the six screws located on the sides of the housing.

Be careful not to bend the gauge assembly during removal. To remove the gauge assemblies from the circuit board, place fingers under each gauge and while applying light straight up pressure, gently rock the gauge from side to side to over come the friction fit of the connector to the circuit board pins.

Place grounding clips (2 required) as illustrated in Figure 1, (part number 1696371C1) at both ends of the housing so the holes in the clips are lined up with the holes that secure the faceplate to the housing. The grounding clip should be positioned so that it will make contact with the gauge when re-installed ( Figure 2and Figure 3).

Use steel wool to remove white paint on the back of the speedometer and tachometer gauge ( Figure 4) when the slips will contact them when re-installed in the housing ( Figure 3). Remove all steel wool debris.

Re-install speedometer and tachometer gauge into housing. Position the gauge over the pins in the circuit board and push the gauge straight down on the pins. Be careful not to bend. Insure that the clips are making good contact.

Re-install faceplate onto housing. Before installing the screws that secure the faceplate to the ends of the housing, be sure the holes in the ground clips are lined up with the screw holes in the housing.
Re-install speedometer/tachometer unit in the vehicle.
